title: Top Instructor Michael Breed to Host New Show on SiriusXM PGA TOUR Radio
text:
Sirius XM Holdings Inc. 
NEW YORK, Sept. 30, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- SiriusXM announced today that Golf Channel's Michael Breed , one of the game's foremost instructors, has joined the roster of hosts on the SiriusXM PGA TOUR Radio channel, where he will host a new show airing twice a week. 
http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnvar/20101014/NY82093LOGO 
A New Breed of Golf will debut October 14 and air live every Wednesday and Thursday morning from 10:00 to 11:00 am ET on SiriusXM PGA TOUR Radio. The channel is available to subscribers nationwide on satellite radios (Sirius channel 208, XM channel 92), on the SiriusXM app and at SiriusXM.com. 
Breed will take calls from golfers around the country, share his sought-after tips for better play at all levels of the game, and discuss the latest golf news, tournaments, players and more. 
"I've dedicated my career to helping golfers of all levels enjoy the game of golf as much as I do," said Breed. "Being on Golf Channel for Golf Fix on Mondays and now on SiriusXM for A New Breed of Golf twice a week will allow me to share my passion for the game more often and with more people than ever before. I'm truly grateful for the opportunity SiriusXM is giving me and I look forward to this new show becoming a fun, entertaining, unique and very high-energy part of the SiriusXM PGA TOUR Radio lineup." 
"Michael is an exceptional teacher, to be sure. He's also a remarkably talented communicator, whether he is instructing or talking about the game's headline news," said Scott Greenstein, SiriusXM's President and Chief Content Officer. "We're very excited to have him on SiriusXM PGA TOUR Radio, where our listeners around the country can connect with him to seek his advice on improving their games or just to talk golf in general." 
Breed ( @MichaelBreed ) has been a PGA Professional for more than two decades and in 2012 received the highest honor of his career when he was chosen as the PGA's National Teacher of the Year. He has been recognized as one of the Top Instructors in America by both GOLF magazine and Golf Digest . He is presently ranked #13 on Golf Digest's Top 50 list, and #1 in the state of New York. He has worked with over 30 PGA Tour, LPGA Tour, Nationwide Tour and Senior Tour players. 
Michael oversees the newly opened Michael Breed Golf Academy at Trump Golf Links at Ferry Point in New York. Formerly, he was the head professional at Sunningdale Country Club and served as assistant pro at Deepdale Golf Club and Augusta National Golf Club. 
Breed hosts The Golf Fix on Golf Channel and is part of Golf Channel's coverage of the Nationwide Tour and PGA TOUR, serving as an on course commentator. He also serves as the analyst for PGA.com in its coverage of the PGA Championship, PGA Professional National Championship, and The Ryder Cup.
